text: you guys are gonna love what I have to
share with you today it's a puff pastry
and apple tart
using one of my favorite convenience
items puff pastry I've taken one sheet
of the puff pastry from the box left it
folded and I'm rolling it out to an 8 by
14 inch rectangle make sure that you
defrost it but then keep it cool in the
refrigerator for up to a day much longer
than a day and it starts to discolor
it's very useful if you measure your
hand span then you can use it as a guide
and you don't have to get out the ruler
give it a trim and make sure the edges
are nice and even this also helps with
the puffing if you've rolled over the
edges it could squish it and make it so
that it doesn't puff so you want a nice
clean edge put it on a baking sheet and
into a freezer for about 10 or 15
minutes while you get your filling ready
the chilling really helps for to keep
the puff pastry shape when it bakes so
it's pretty important I have three
granny smith apples they need to be
peeled and then cut into quarter-inch
thick slices you can use an apple corer
to get the cores out I just like to cut
around the core I feel like maybe I lose
a little bit of Apple but I find it fast
and I don't need a specialty tool for it
so it's a trade-off I suppose
so I just cut around the core and I do
like to go back in and just just to make
myself feel good slice off these little
edges around the core and then I feel
like I've gotten the most out of my
Apple that I can without using a corer
then you want to mix your apples with
1/3 of a cup of granulated sugar stir it
up and then one last thing before you
get your tart shell you need to make an
egg wash take one large egg yolk no need
for the white you can do a whole egg if
you want but you know you just need the
yolk and I was saving the white I'll
just get rid of the white add my yolk
whisk it a little bit and then add a
teaspoon of water all right now I'm
ready to get my dough
nice and chilled brush it with your egg
wash make sure that the egg wash doesn't
drip down the sides of the pastry either
that will also inhibit thing rising then
create a border by cutting about halfway
through the dough not all the way
through three-quarters of an inch from
the edge and arrange the apples within
that border spread them all the way to
the edges of the border but not
overlapping the border the border will
puff up around the apples making a nice
little edge dot the top with two
tablespoons of butter and have your oven
preheating to 375 degrees bake this
until it's puffed and golden it in the
apples are tender at 375 that'll take
about 30 to 35 minutes then when it's
still a little bit warm you can brush it
with a glaze made with two tablespoons
of apricot jam heat it up with a
tablespoon of water and you just brush
it over and it gets nice and shiny and
beautiful and very professional-looking
most pie shops brush a glaze over their
fruit tarts that's the difference
between them and you and now you can be
just like them or just like me I know
that's all of your dreams beautiful
right you can make this at home so
easily it's only six ingredients and
you're not you couldn't be more happy
with the results I don't think serve it
warm or room temperature serve it for
dessert or for breakfast delicious
so good we're Nesmith are really nice
and tang to I implore you to try this
one I think you'll really love it hi
guys thanks for watching this video be
sure to click here if you want to
subscribe and click over here if you
want to continue watching more great
videos like this
